title: Worth visiting place
review: Most famous place in bhimtal. Garden on both side makes it perfect place. View of mountains with cool air of lacke is worth watching

title: Take a walk...
review: If you are in Bhimtal, especially on the "other side of the lake" (other side from the main road) -- you can go for a walk and likely there will not be too many cars... so you will enjoy the lake and then see the dam which makes it happen...

title: Nainitaal love you yaar
review: Me And My Friend Visited The nainitaal lake

title: Terrific Views from the DAM
review: Located at end of Bhimtal Lake this dam is adorned with beautiful flower gardens on either sides of the lake. A 17th century historic Bhimeshwar temple located next to the dam attracts hordes of people during festival time. Tourists can stroll through the huge forests surrounding the dam. The dam around 40 feet’s high offers scenic views of the surroundings and lures the tourists with its wild flowers. The area in the vicinity of the dam is serene and tranquil offering relaxation from stresses and strains.

title: Best place for selfies / photos in Bhimtal
review: This is best place to take selfies / photographs in Bhimtal. You get stunning view of the lake and the mountains.

title: Click some nice photos from the dam by @GhumantuBaba
review: Dam is right next to the Bhimtal Lake tourist spot. Next to the dam an ancient 17th century Bhimeshwar Mahadev temple.

title: Nothing to see in the Dam
review: Victoria dam is situated at the end of the lake. I did not find anything special in the dam. I dont know why other persons have given it so many stars in their reviews. Place is not properly cleaned. No fresh water in the dam only stalled dirty water. Dont get the feeling of a dam. There is a small temple near the lake one can visit it. There is a place where you can click photos that is nice. There is a small path to walk but some persons are coming with their scooty and bykes on the path as it connect the two ends of the path.

title: Not very attractive
review: Situated on the eastern side of Bhimtal lake the dam is meant for drain out the excess water of the lake specially in rainy season. very small and the causeway on it connects two banks of the lake just beside the famous Bhimeswar Temple.

title: average
review: The so called dam is just a low wall trying to reign in the waters of the lake. It is located at an end of the lake and can be seen from the street which runs a round the lake. It had weeds growing and moss over the wall.

title: Bhimeshwar temple
review: Just on the edge of the dam and the bank of Bhimtal lake there an ancient temple by the name of the Bhimeshwar temple belonging to lord Shiva. The original structure made of stone has been replaced by a brick and mortar structure albeit of the same shape. Many devotees throng this place during the day.

title: Freebie of bhimtal lake
review: This is not actually a dam but a small water retaining structure located at the end of bhimtal lake to hold water. This has sluice arrangement to release the water from bhimtal lake as and when required. When the water is fully opened from the gate, water will gush out through the sluice gate with beauty. Whereas that situation may come only during rainy season and hardly during rain no one can access that area. There is small stream which carries the water coming out of this. There is pedestrian way over the so called dam through which only we can access the Bhimeshwara mahadev temple built by Bheema. So, it can be understood that you need not plan and visit this dam. It comes as a freebie if you are planning a trip to either Bhimtal lake or to the Bhimeshwara mahadev temple.

title: Nothing great
review: Nothing worth mentioning...it lies at one end of the Taal. Since the water was too less the dam was just holding water.

title: Old Arch Dam
review: A dam 100 years old holds the lake waters for summers and has Bhimeshwar Mahadev temple on other side.

title: Best spot
review: Best view point in bhimtal lake. Here lies the bhimeshwar mahadev shrine. Its peaceful n spirited. Do visit. Dont miss the photo of old temple n ancient nandi idol

title: Nice one and temple located adjacent to it
review: Went for an evening walk with my partner soon after checking in hotel and had a great time. Has a lot of eateries around it like Maggi Point...and it was a good experience and has near by boat ride team.

title: Best in Bhimtal
review: Perfect for evening and morning walking. Eateries are in huge number. Located at end of lack. Afternoon walking is worth one with cool breeze

title: Beautiful Place
review: Victoria Dam is located at the end of himtal lake. 40 feet high dam is very beautiful place for the tourists. Garden with beautiful flowers at the both end of the dam is very good place to visit. Very pictures view and must visit place.
